items.title: CVE-2026-26198
items.key_takeaway: Ormar 0.9.9–0.22.0 allows SQL injection via min()/max() aggregate calls; upgrade to >=0.23.0 immediately.

items.title: CVE-2026-26331
items.key_takeaway: yt-dlp <2026.02.21 allows command injection via the --netrc-cmd option; upgrade to ≥2026.02.21 or avoid using this option.

items.title: CVE-2026-27952
items.key_takeaway: Agenta-API versions before 0.48.1 allow sandbox escape via a whitelisted numpy package, enabling arbitrary code execution; upgrade to >=0.48.1 (or >=0.60 where the sandbox is removed) immediately.

items.title: CVE-2026-27966
items.key_takeaway: Langflow versions prior to 1.8.0 expose a dangerous REPL via the CSV Agent node (allow_dangerous_code=True), enabling RCE through prompt injection; upgrade to >=1.8.0 immediately.

items.title: CVE-2025-69985
items.key_takeaway: FUXA versions <=1.2.8 trust the Referer header for JWT validation, allowing unauthenticated authentication bypass and RCE via the /api/runscript endpoint; upgrade to a fixed version immediately.

items.title: CVE-2026-27699
items.key_takeaway: basic-ftp versions prior to 5.2.0 allow path traversal via the downloadToDir() method, enabling files to be written outside the intended directory; upgrade to >=5.2.0 to remediate.

items.title: CVE-2026-27903
items.key_takeaway: minimatch versions prior to the listed fixes can be forced into exponential backtracking with crafted glob patterns, stalling the Node.js event loop for seconds; upgrade to >=10.2.3, 9.0.7, 8.0.6, 7.4.8, 6.2.2, 5.1.8, 4.2.5, or 3.1.3 and validate or limit user‑supplied glob inputs.

items.title: CVE-2026-27959
items.key_takeaway: Koa versions prior to 3.1.2 (or 2.16.4) parse the Host header without validation, allowing attacker‑controlled values via malformed Host headers; upgrade Koa and avoid using ctx.hostname for security‑critical URL generation.

items.title: CVE-2026-27208
items.key_takeaway: bleon-ethical/api-gateway-deploy version 1.0.0 allows OS command injection and privilege escalation leading to container escape; upgrade to >=1.0.1, enforce non‑root user and input sanitization.

items.title: CVE-2026-27899
items.key_takeaway: WireGuard Portal versions prior to 2.1.3 allow any authenticated user to gain admin rights by setting "IsAdmin": true in their profile update; upgrade to >=2.1.3 and ensure protected fields are not overwritten.

items.title: CVE-2026-2794
items.key_takeaway: Firefox versions prior to 148 contain an information‑disclosure bug caused by uninitialized memory; upgrade to Firefox 148 or later to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-2800
items.key_takeaway: Firefox for Android and Thunderbird versions prior to 148 have a critical WebAuthn spoofing vulnerability (CVE‑2026‑2800); upgrade to version 148 or later to mitigate.

items.title: CVE-2026-2634
items.key_takeaway: Firefox for iOS versions before 147.4 have a critical address-bar spoofing vulnerability (CVE‑2026‑2634); upgrade to 147.4 or later to mitigate.

items.title: OWASP Mobile Application Security Testing Guide (MASTG)
items.key_takeaway: The OWASP Mobile Application Security Testing Guide provides a comprehensive, up‑to‑date methodology and test cases for securing iOS and Android apps, serving as a core reference for mobile security testing and hardening.

items.title: OWASP Mobile Application Security Verification Standard (MASVS)
items.key_takeaway: The OWASP MASVS defines a comprehensive set of security requirements for mobile apps, providing a baseline for designing, building, and verifying secure iOS and Android applications.

items.title: OWASP Top 10 for Web Applications
items.key_takeaway: The OWASP Top 10 provides essential awareness of the most critical web application security risks, serving as a foundational reference for secure design, coding, and testing of web applications.
